t: The*pn one who scatters has come up against you. Man*ln the fortress, watch the road; Strengthen*ln your back, summon all your*i strength.
For*ln the Lord*s will restore the splendor of Jacob Like*ln the splendor of Israel, Even*ln though devastators have devastated them And*ln destroyed their vine branches.

The*ln shields of his mighty men are colored*i red, The*ln warriors are dressed in scarlet, The*ln chariots are enveloped*i in flashing steel When*ln he is prepared to*i march,*i And*ln the cypress spears*i are brandished.
The*ln chariots race madly in the streets, They*ln rush wildly in the squares, Their*ln appearance is like torches, They*ln dash to and fro like lightning flashes.
He*ln remembers his nobles; They*ln stumble in their march, They*ln hurry to her wall, And*ln the mantelet is set up.
The*ln gates of the rivers are opened And*ln the palace is dissolved.
It*ln is fixed: She*ln is stripped, she is carried away, And*ln her handmaids are moaning like the sound of doves, Beating*ln on their breasts.
Though*ln Nineveh was*i like a pool of water throughout her days, Now*ln they are fleeing; “Stop,*ln stop,” But*ln no one turns back.
Plunder*ln the silver! Plunder*ln the gold! For*ln there is no limit to the treasure— Wealth*ln from every kind of desirable object.
She*ln is emptied! Yes, she is desolate and waste! Hearts*ln are melting and knees knocking! Also*ln anguish is in the whole body And*ln all their faces are grown pale!
Where*ln is the den of the lions And*ln the feeding place of the young lions, Where*ln the lion, lioness and lion’s cub prowled, With*ln nothing to disturb them?*i
The*ln lion tore enough for his cubs, Killed*ln enough*i for his lionesses, And*ln filled his lairs with prey And*ln his dens with torn flesh.

“Behold,*p I am against you,” declares the Lord*s of hosts. “I will burn up her chariots in smoke, a sword will devour your young lions; I will cut off your prey from the land, and no longer will the voice of your messengers be heard.”
